description: Variation of condition 2 (Approved Drawings) of Planning Permission PP/2015/1629 dated 03/11/2015 for 'Demolition of existing buildings on site and redevelopment of the site to provide a 2-storey terrace building comprising of 6 x 3-bed dwelling houses and 2 x 2-bed flats and a detached 2-storey 3-bed dwelling house, with associated access drive, car parking for 9 cars, cycle storage, landscaping, boundary treatment, refuse storage and individual amenity spaces'(minor material amendment to alter footprint siting of House 9 and associated alterations to the elevations)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date PP/2015/1629 was approved dated 02.11.2015.

REASON : In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) S3014/SLP; S3014/01; S3014/02; S3014/P/01 Rev A (received 09/06/2014); S3014/P/02 Rev A (received 09/06/2014); S3014/H01 Rev A (received 09/06/2014); S3014/H02; S3014/H03; S3014/H04; S3014/H05; S3014/H06; S3014/H07; S3014/H08;; P3014/P/03 Rev A (received 09/06/2014); S3014/P/04 Rev A (received 09/06/2014); S3014/P/05 Rev A (received 09/06/2014); 527-002 Rev A (received 10/06/2015); 527-003 (received 09/06/2014); 52-004 (received 09/06/2014); 52-005 (received 09/06/2014);and S3014/H09A; S3014/H10A; 047.001 Rev H; 047.002 Rev F received 21/06/2016 Sustainability Statement prepared by Simon Hodges and dated 18th March 2015; Landscape Design Statement Rev B prepared by ALU and dated 25th March 2015; and Planning Statement prepared by South Bank Architects and dated March 2015 (all drawings received 26/03/2015 unless stated otherwise).

REASON : For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | The refuse and recycling storage shall be implemented in accordance with the Local Planning Authority policies before the first occupation of any of the dwellings hereby approved and retained permanently thereafter. This area shall not be used for any other purpose.

REASON: To provide adequate refuse and recycling storage to protect the amenities of the area and the living conditions of occupiers of the proposed residential units and the surrounding area, in accordance with policy 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policies 5.3 and 5.16 of the London Plan (2015). | Sheltered and secure cycle parking for 18 cycles as indicated on the approved plans shall be in place prior to first occupation of the development hereby permitted and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for cycle parking.

REASON: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided within the development in pursuance of the objectives of sustainability and encouraging the use of modes of transport other than private motor vehicles in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2015); policies 1.1(k) and (g) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 (2012); and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG. | Notwithstanding the submitted plans, no occupation of the dwelling hereby approved shall take place until full details of boundary treatments and hard/soft landscaping works (including details on the 'Home Zone' and treatment of the pedestrian access to May Gardens) and a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be completed as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.

REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and screening of the proposal from neighbouring properties, and in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 3.5, 7.4, 7.6 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2015). | A sustainable surface water drainage scheme based on sustainable drainage principles, shall be integrated into the proposal and fully operational prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved and thereafter permanently retained and mantained.

REASON: To ensure the drainage measures comply with Thames Water/Environment Agency requirements, and to prevent the increased risk of flooding in accordance with policy 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policies 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (m) of Ealing's Development Strategy 2026; policies 5.12, 5.13 and 5.14 of the London Plan (2015) and section 10 of the National Planning Policy Framework. | The development hereby approved shall comply with the standards of Secured By Design, be implemented before the first occupation of the development, and shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interest of the safety of the occupiers and visitors to the premises, in accordance with the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.1 and 7.3 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding any details submitted with this application, the first-floor windows on the north-facing elevation that serve the bathrooms, ensuite facilities and combined living/kitchen/dining area shall be fully obscured glazed and fixed shut 1.7m and above internal floor level.

REASON: To ensure the privacy of neighbouring sites in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015). | Notwithstanding any details submitted with this application, the 1.8m high privacy screening/panel shown on the approved plans for the first-floor flat balcony shall be constructed from obscured materials, implemented prior to the first-use of the amenity area and retained in perpetuity.

REASON: To ensure the privacy of neighbouring sites in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015). | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, the residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to the Lifetime Homes Standards.

Reason: To ensure that the development is accessible by all future occupiers, in accordance with policy 1.1 (h) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 3.5 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.2 of The London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D E and F of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any subsequent order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modifications),  no enlargement, improvement or other alteration to the dwellinghouse hereby approved shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

REASON: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and the visual appearance of the buildings and the area as a whole,  in accordance with policies 1.1 (g) (h), 1.2 (f), 3.1(b) and 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015).
